lines.text: It's only one fly in the serum. I can't reproduce it.
What do you mean?
None of the new samples work and I have very little of the original serum left. That's what I mean when I say I can't reproduce it.
Wait a minute. I don't understand.
Now you have it and now you don't.
I found a cure for the plague of the 20th century, and now I've lost it!
Jesus Christ, woman, must everything be a full-scale debate with you? Just do it!

[referring to the blue tattoo on Dr. Crane's forehead that the Rain Forest Medicine Man gave her while she was sleeping]
Oh come on Bronx. Do you really think that Tommy Fallon is going to want to walk down the aisle with a woman who's 'something blue' is a tattoo on her forehead?
You must have thought you were really on to something.
I don't think, I know.
You send me back on the basis of my gender. That's called sex disrimination. Look, I understand your reservations. I heard about your wife.
My wife? Good God, she left me. I wish you'd follow her example.
Yeah, but closing your eyes won't make it disapear.
Neither will talk.
I gave Alka-Seltzer to a kid with a belly ache.
You did what?
Alka-Seltzer. Cured him in one belch. It was the 'plop-plop'-'fizz-fizz' that really dazzled them.
[lowering themselves from a cliff, they reach the end of their ropes, still dangling in the air]
What happened?
Nothing happened.
What happened?
[sees the end of her rope]
What happened? What do we do? What do we do now? *This* is a RESCUE?
[starts kicking out at him]
This is a rescue? What's the matter with you? You idiot! This isn't a rescue, this is a suicide pact!
[kicks away Campbell's hand as he reaches to steady her line]
No!
Calm down! Give me your hand!
What for?
[Campbell pulls out his knife and puts the blade to Rae's rope as Rae looks up, horror stricken]
What are you, crazy?

[Campbell cuts her rope and Rae plummets down , landing feet first into the lake below]
Ahhhhhhh!
[before the rescue]
Don't cry. Listen, when this is over you can cry all you want, and I won't say a word.
[after the rescue]
Don't cry.

[sobbing]
You said I could cry all I want.
Oh yes, I did, didn't I? Okay. Go ahead, knock yourself out.
[telling Campbell about her fiance]
You may know him. Tom Fallon?

[incredulous]
Tom Fallon? He's almost eighty years old! You'll inherit before the honeymoon's over! I take my hat off to you, my dear.

[annoyed]
His son!
Oh. Oh no, I don't know his son.
Look, if I wanted to kill us, I'd have find better ways, no?
Nooooooo!
Come on! Let go! Rae, let go!
Ok...
[Rae is still unsure]
LET GO!
OK!
[squeezes her eyes shut, and lets go of the branch]
Wooo Ahhh Ahh Ahh! Wuuuhh!
[the line which Campbell has tied around her holds, and Rae swings back and then comes to be suspended next to the hill]
See? Nothing to worry about.
[Campbell begins to lower himself down and motions for Rae to do the same]

[Campbell and Rae are around a campfire, Rae is taking heavy swigs of the contents of Campbell's jug]
Careful, that's peach Pernod, huh?

[tries to stand up, and then sits down clumsily, very drunk]
Why, I'm not driving!
Or walking, apparently.

[drunkenly laughs]
. Wooo! No wonder you like this stuff!

[Campbell moves over to her, brings her to her feet and seeing Rae is in no condition to walk, puts his arm between her legs, and in one motion, picks her up and cradles her in his arms, carrying her over to the hammock. Rae laughs drunkenly again as she is literally swept off her feet and begins to sing, horribly off key]
I'm in a spin, lovin' the spin I'm in! Come on, Campbell! Big finish, come on, sing us a bar! He He He! Come on!

[Campbell, very sober, begins to sing the first few words and Rae follows suit]
There have been words, what can I do? I'm in a name, I'm in a flame...
[Campbell trails off, Rae sings the last word]
Come on, sing it!
Get some sleep, Rae.
[Campbell begins to walk away]
Doooon't!
What?
Don't call me by my given name!
Don't you like it?
Yeaaaah, I like it...
[Rae slowly passes out as the hammock swings her to sleep, Campbell looks back to the hammock, and then back to the campfire]
I don't need a fuckin' interpreter!
Have you ever lost anything Doctor Ornega ? Your passport? Your car keys? It wasn't the bromeliad, it was the ants.
You are certain?
Ah ha!
[Rae sighs, and looks around at the ruin caused by the fires]
I seem to have kept the evidence in my other suit.
Not get my head knocked off in the process.
[Campbell and the Medicine Man are in a battle of wills and walking sticks, while Campbell asks more specifics about the makeup of the serum to cure cancer]
[shouting at Campbell, and banging his walking stick on the ground]

[translating for Rae]
He say, he born of a monkey...
[speaks in the native tongue]

[translates for Rae]
Father, you talk gods, know all things...
Yeah, nice kiss.
[shouting at Campbell in native tongue]

[translating to Rae]
He say, he have no father...
[speaks in native tongue]

[translates to Rae]
Father, need ju-ju for sick boy. World hold many sick boy...
[shouting at Campbell in native tongue]

[translates to Rae]
He say, bring here...
[shouting at Campbell in native tongue while fighting Campbell]

[translating to Rae]
He say, he no more can get it up than...

[looks back to Tanaki and Rae, momentarily distracted]
I don't need a fuckin' interpreter!
I do!
[Campbell gets hit in the thigh by the Medicine Man's staff as a result of the distraction, Rae winces in sympathy pain]
Awwwww!

[in a slightly low but agitated tone]
Watch your step, runt!
Campbell...
[Rae cautions Campbell to continue to eat crow to get the information they came for]
[Campbell makes a peaceful motion, slightly raising his staff horizontally in the air but not leaving himself open for attack and speaks in the native tongue]

[translating for Rae]
Father, its too far. Ju-Ju in sky flower?
[both Campbell and the Medicine Man circle each other, feigning and parrying off each attack from each other, talking as they fight]
What did he say, what did he say?
AHHHHHHHHH!

[the Medicine Man tries to knock Campbell off his feet with his staff as he shouts a reply, but Campbell blocks the attack and the fight ends, a distressed look comes over Campbell's face. The Medicine Man snuffs Campbell, and walks away]
What did he say, what did he say?

[translates to Rae]
No ju-ju sky flower... only house for bugs. Campbell's a fool.
Well, we're back to square one. Where did I go wrong, the kissing up or the eating crow part?
Well, it wasn't a total loss.
[Rae looks past Campbell. One of the natives has just walked up and looks to Campbell for help; he holds his sick child, now dying, in his arms]
